dfischer.utils

Class JarFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.JarFile

  • public class JarFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Remove Class-Path and Main-Class from a JAR file manifest.
    Since:
    5.5-F, back ported to V5.4-N

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JarFile(byte[] jarFileData)
      Create a new instance by passing the binary content-data of the Jar file (in memory execution).
      JarFile(java.io.File jarFile)
      Create a new instance by reading all of the data of an existing Jar file.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Get all ZIP entries of the Jar file.
      boolean isManifestModified()
      Get if the manifest was modified.
      boolean isSigned()
      Get if the Jar file is signed.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Internal test program.
      boolean stripClasspathFromManifest()
      Remove the Class-Path and the Main-Class from the manifest (if any).
      void writeJar(java.io.File jarFile)
      Overwrite the old Jar file by the new one.
      void writeJar(java.lang.String newJarFile)
      Write a copy of the Jar file back to disk.
      byte[] writeJarToByteArray()
      Write the content of the jar into a byte array (in memory execution).

      • stripClasspathFromManifest

        public boolean stripClasspathFromManifest()
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Remove the Class-Path and the Main-Class from the manifest (if any). Note that no action is performed for digitally signed Jars.
        Returns:
        true if there was a Class-Path or a Main-Class in the manifest
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

      • isSigned

        public boolean isSigned()
        Get if the Jar file is signed.
        Returns:
        true if the Jar file is signed.

      • isManifestModified

        public boolean isManifestModified()
        Get if the manifest was modified.
        Returns:
        true if the manifest was modified

      • writeJar

        public void writeJar(java.lang.String newJarFile)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Write a copy of the Jar file back to disk.
        Parameters:
        newJarFile - the name or the disk path of the Jar file to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeJar

              throws java.io.IOException
        Overwrite the old Jar file by the new one.
